content.description: A block on an incline is initially at rest. There is nonnegligible friction between the block and the incline. In Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the block is given a brief push at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, and begins to slide down the incline with speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. In Scenario <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math>, the block is placed at the same initial position, is given a brief push at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, and begins to slide up the incline with initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, as shown. The direction down the ramp corresponds to positive velocity.
content.question:
Which of the following pairs of velocity-time graphs could correctly represent the motion of the block in Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Scenario <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> ?

Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>:Block Travels Down Incline
 Scenario <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>:Block Travels Up Incline

A

B

C

D

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
